trans-unit.source: testmdarticle
trans-unit.target: testmdarticle

trans-unit.source: Migrate and upgrade virtual machines
trans-unit.target: Migrate and upgrade virtual machines

trans-unit.source: If you move virtual machines to your Windows 10 host that were originally created with Hyper-V in Windows 8.1 or earlier, you won't be able to use the new virtual machine features until you manually update the virtual machine configuration version.
trans-unit.target: If you move virtual machines to your Windows 10 host that were originally created with Hyper-V in Windows 8.1 or earlier, you won't be able to use the new virtual machine features until you manually update the virtual machine configuration version.

trans-unit.source: To upgrade the configuration version, shut down the virtual machine and then select to Upgrade Virtual Machine Configuration in Hyper-V Manager.
trans-unit.target: To upgrade the configuration version, shut down the virtual machine and then select to Upgrade Virtual Machine Configuration in Hyper-V Manager.

trans-unit.source: You can also open an elevated Windows PowerShell command prompt, and type:
trans-unit.target: You can also open an elevated Windows PowerShell command prompt, and type:

trans-unit.source: ```PowerShell Update-VmVersion <vmname> | <vmobject>
trans-unit.target: ```PowerShell Update-VmVersion <vmname> | <vmobject>

trans-unit.source: Name State CPUUsage(%) MemoryAssigned(M) Uptime Status Version
trans-unit.target: Name State CPUUsage(%) MemoryAssigned(M) Uptime Status Version

trans-unit.source: Atlantis Running 0 1024 00:04:20.5910000 Operating normally 5.0
trans-unit.target: Atlantis Running 0 1024 00:04:20.5910000 Operating normally 5.0

trans-unit.source: SGC VM Running 0 538 00:02:44.8350000 Operating normally 6.2 ```
trans-unit.target: SGC VM Running 0 538 00:02:44.8350000 Operating normally 6.2 ```

trans-unit.source: What happens if I do not upgrade the configuration version?
trans-unit.target: What happens if I do not upgrade the configuration version?

trans-unit.source: If you have virtual machines that you created with an earlier version of Hyper-V, some features may not work with those virtual machines until you update the VM version.
trans-unit.target: If you have virtual machines that you created with an earlier version of Hyper-V, some features may not work with those virtual machines until you update the VM version.

trans-unit.source: Minimum VM configuration version for new Hyper-V features:
trans-unit.target: Minimum VM configuration version for new Hyper-V features:

trans-unit.source: Feature Name
trans-unit.target: Feature Name

trans-unit.source: Minimum VM version
trans-unit.target: Minimum VM version

trans-unit.target: Hot Add/Remove Memory

trans-unit.target: Hot Add/Remove Network Adapters

trans-unit.target: Secure Boot for Linux VMs

trans-unit.target: Production Checkpoints

trans-unit.target: PowerShell Direct

trans-unit.target: Virtual Trusted Platform Module (vTPM)

trans-unit.source: Virtual Machine Grouping
trans-unit.target: Virtual Machine Grouping

trans-unit.source: Virtual Machine Configuration Version
trans-unit.target: Virtual Machine Configuration Version

trans-unit.source: When you move or import a virtual machine to a host running Hyper-V on Windows 10 from host running Windows 8.1, the virtual machine’s configuration file isn't automatically upgraded.
trans-unit.target: When you move or import a virtual machine to a host running Hyper-V on Windows 10 from host running Windows 8.1, the virtual machine’s configuration file isn't automatically upgraded.

trans-unit.source: This allows the virtual machine to be moved back to a host running Windows 8.1.
trans-unit.target: This allows the virtual machine to be moved back to a host running Windows 8.1.

trans-unit.source: You won't have access to new virtual machine features until you manually update the virtual machine configuration version.
trans-unit.target: You won't have access to new virtual machine features until you manually update the virtual machine configuration version.

trans-unit.source: The virtual machine configuration version represents what version of Hyper-V the virtual machine’s configuration, saved state, and snapshot files it's compatible with.
trans-unit.target: The virtual machine configuration version represents what version of Hyper-V the virtual machine’s configuration, saved state, and snapshot files it's compatible with.

trans-unit.source: Virtual machines with configuration version 5 are compatible with Windows 8.1 and can run on both Windows 8.1 and Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: Virtual machines with configuration version 5 are compatible with Windows 8.1 and can run on both Windows 8.1 and Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: Virtual machines with configuration version 6 are compatible with Windows 10 and won't run on Windows 8.1.
trans-unit.target: Virtual machines with configuration version 6 are compatible with Windows 10 and won't run on Windows 8.1.

trans-unit.source: It is not necessary to upgrade all of your virtual machines simultaneously.
trans-unit.target: It is not necessary to upgrade all of your virtual machines simultaneously.

trans-unit.source: You can choose to upgrade specific virtual machines when required.
trans-unit.target: You can choose to upgrade specific virtual machines when required.

trans-unit.source: However, you won't have access to new the virtual machine features until you manually update the configuration version for each virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: However, you won't have access to new the virtual machine features until you manually update the configuration version for each virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: • After you upgrade the virtual machine configuration version, you can't move the virtual machine to a host that runs Windows 8.1.
trans-unit.target: • After you upgrade the virtual machine configuration version, you can't move the virtual machine to a host that runs Windows 8.1.

trans-unit.source: • You can't downgrade the virtual machine configuration version from version 6 to version 5.
trans-unit.target: • You can't downgrade the virtual machine configuration version from version 6 to version 5.

trans-unit.source: • You must turn off the virtual machine to upgrade the virtual machine configuration.
trans-unit.target: • You must turn off the virtual machine to upgrade the virtual machine configuration.

trans-unit.source: • After the upgrade, the virtual machine uses the new configuration file format.
trans-unit.target: • After the upgrade, the virtual machine uses the new configuration file format.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see New virtual machine configuration file format.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see New virtual machine configuration file format.

trans-unit.source: What happens when I upgrade the version of a virtual machine?
trans-unit.target: What happens when I upgrade the version of a virtual machine?

trans-unit.source: When you manually upgrade the configuration version of a virtual machine to version 6.x, you'll change the file structure that is used for storing the virtual machines configuration and checkpoint files.
trans-unit.target: When you manually upgrade the configuration version of a virtual machine to version 6.x, you'll change the file structure that is used for storing the virtual machines configuration and checkpoint files.

trans-unit.source: Upgraded virtual machines use a new configuration file format, which is designed to increase the efficiency of reading and writing virtual machine configuration data.
trans-unit.target: Upgraded virtual machines use a new configuration file format, which is designed to increase the efficiency of reading and writing virtual machine configuration data.

trans-unit.source: The upgrade also reduces the potential for data corruption in the event of a storage failure.
trans-unit.target: The upgrade also reduces the potential for data corruption in the event of a storage failure.

trans-unit.source: The following table lists the binary file locations and extension information for an upgraded virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: The following table lists the binary file locations and extension information for an upgraded virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Virtual machine configuration and checkpoint files (version 6.x)
trans-unit.target: Virtual machine configuration and checkpoint files (version 6.x)

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Virtual machine configuration
trans-unit.target: Virtual machine configuration

trans-unit.source: Configuration information is stored in a binary file format that uses the .vmcx extension.
trans-unit.target: Configuration information is stored in a binary file format that uses the .vmcx extension.

trans-unit.source: Virtual machine Runtime State
trans-unit.target: Virtual machine Runtime State

trans-unit.source: Runtime state data is stored in a binary file format that uses the .vmrs extension.
trans-unit.target: Runtime state data is stored in a binary file format that uses the .vmrs extension.

trans-unit.source: Virtual machine virtual hard disk
trans-unit.target: Virtual machine virtual hard disk

trans-unit.source: The virtual hard disk files for the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: The virtual hard disk files for the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: They use .vhd or .vhdx file extensions.
trans-unit.target: They use .vhd or .vhdx file extensions.

trans-unit.source: Automatic virtual hard disk files
trans-unit.target: Automatic virtual hard disk files

trans-unit.source: The differencing disk files used for virtual machine checkpoints.
trans-unit.target: The differencing disk files used for virtual machine checkpoints.

trans-unit.source: They use the .avhdx file extensions.
trans-unit.target: They use the .avhdx file extensions.

trans-unit.source: Checkpoint Files
trans-unit.target: Checkpoint Files

trans-unit.source: Checkpoints are stored in multiple checkpoint files.
trans-unit.target: Checkpoints are stored in multiple checkpoint files.

trans-unit.source: Each checkpoint creates a configuration file and runtime state file.
trans-unit.target: Each checkpoint creates a configuration file and runtime state file.

trans-unit.source: Checkpoint files use the .vmrs and .vmcx file extensions.
trans-unit.target: Checkpoint files use the .vmrs and .vmcx file extensions.

trans-unit.source: These new file formats are also used for production checkpoints and standard checkpoints.
trans-unit.target: These new file formats are also used for production checkpoints and standard checkpoints.

trans-unit.source: After you upgrade the virtual machine configuration version to version 6.x, it is not possible to downgrade from version 6.x to version 5.
trans-unit.target: After you upgrade the virtual machine configuration version to version 6.x, it is not possible to downgrade from version 6.x to version 5.

trans-unit.source: The virtual machine must be turned off to upgrade the virtual machine configuration.
trans-unit.target: The virtual machine must be turned off to upgrade the virtual machine configuration.

trans-unit.source: The following table lists the default file locations for new or upgraded virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: The following table lists the default file locations for new or upgraded virtual machines.

trans-unit.source: Virtual Machine Files (Version 6.x)
trans-unit.target: Virtual Machine Files (Version 6.x)

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Virtual machine configuration file
trans-unit.target: Virtual machine configuration file

trans-unit.source: C:\ProgramData\Microsoft\Windows\Hyper-V\Virtual Machines
trans-unit.target: C:\ProgramData\Microsoft\Windows\Hyper-V\Virtual Machines

trans-unit.source: Virtual machine runtime state file
trans-unit.target: Virtual machine runtime state file

trans-unit.source: C:\ProgramData\Microsoft\Windows\Hyper-V\Virtual Machines
trans-unit.target: C:\ProgramData\Microsoft\Windows\Hyper-V\Virtual Machines

trans-unit.source: Checkpoint Files (.vmrs, .vmcx)
trans-unit.target: Checkpoint Files (.vmrs, .vmcx)

trans-unit.source: C:\ProgramData\Microsoft\Windows\Snapshots
trans-unit.target: C:\ProgramData\Microsoft\Windows\Snapshots

trans-unit.source: Virtual hard disk file (.vhd/.vhdx)
trans-unit.target: Virtual hard disk file (.vhd/.vhdx)

trans-unit.source: C:\Users\Public\Documents\Hyper-V\Virtual Hard Disks
trans-unit.target: C:\Users\Public\Documents\Hyper-V\Virtual Hard Disks

trans-unit.source: Automatic virtual hard disk files (.avhdx)
trans-unit.target: Automatic virtual hard disk files (.avhdx)

trans-unit.source: C:\Users\Public\Documents\Hyper-V\Virtual Hard Disks
trans-unit.target: C:\Users\Public\Documents\Hyper-V\Virtual Hard Disks
